gettingStarted.desc: NabdaOTP provides a simple REST API for sending WhatsApp messages (including OTP codes). Follow these steps to integrate message sending into your application.
gettingStarted.step1: Create an account and set up your instance
gettingStarted.step2: Connect your WhatsApp number by scanning the QR code
gettingStarted.step3: Get your instance API key from the Instances page
gettingStarted.step4: Make your first API call to send a message

auth.desc: The API uses two authentication methods. Dashboard endpoints use a Bearer JWT token. The message sending endpoint uses your instance API key directly in the Authorization header.
auth.securityDesc: Never expose your API key in client-side code. Always make API calls from your server.

sendMessage.desc: Send a WhatsApp message to a phone number. Use this endpoint from your backend to deliver OTP codes or notifications.
sendMessage.messageDesc: Message content to send (e.g. "Your code is 123456")

getMessages.desc: Retrieve the message history for your current instance. Supports filtering by status and pagination.

rateLimits.desc: API rate limits are applied per instance to ensure fair usage.
